dca4987b-3984-48de-872a-a7bab0dc8e7f.description: Earners of this badge volunteered to train and act as a Green Impact auditor for ACTS. Green Impact is a social change and engagement program that fosters sustainability and social responsibility in the work, study and home environment. The badge holder took part in the Green Impact audit training, conducted at least one audit with a Green Impact team and successfully submitted an audit report.
dca4987b-3984-48de-872a-a7bab0dc8e7f.name: Green Impact Auditor

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has taken part in ACTS' Green Impact audit training. The training covered sustainability from a broad perspective to its practical implications in the work, study place and/or at home. Earner gained the necessary knowledge to conduct a Green Impact audit, and successfully used this information to assess how teams from the participating organisation have acted to promote sustainability in their environment.

Earner conducted at least one audit of a Green Impact team, developing their professional auditing, analytical, and relationship building skills. The audits require the earner to review documentary evidence teams have uploaded to support their sustainability work, as well as interview team members. Earner then assessed the teams in a report, using the Green Impact criteria and scoring system, and provided feedback to the program organisers.

Earner contributed to the Green Impact program, outcomes of which are to create a more eco-friendly, inclusive, fair, and thriving organisation. The program creates an engaged community who is more aware of sustainability issues and motivated to act upon this awareness by realising multiple actions.
This badge is only available to students enrolled in an Australasian Higher Education Institution.

1a04218f-10fe-454e-8d48-4a985ce5ae36.description: Earners of this badge have returned to volunteer with ACTS after earning their initial Green Impact Auditor credential. Green Impact is a social change and engagement program that fosters sustainability and social responsibility in the work, study and home environment. The badge holder took part in a refresher Green Impact audit training session, and has successfully conducted multiple Green Impact audits from participating teams across two or more organisations.
1a04218f-10fe-454e-8d48-4a985ce5ae36.name: Experienced Green Impact Auditor

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has taken part in ACTS' Green Impact refresher audit training session. The earner further developed their practical skills in conducting a Green Impact audit, and used these skills to assess how teams from the participating organisation have acted to promote sustainability in their environment.

Earner has conducted multiple audits of Green Impact teams, further developing their professional auditing, analytical, and relationship building skills. The audits require the earner to review documentary evidence teams have uploaded to support their sustainability work, as well as interview team members. Earner then assessed the teams in a report, using the Green Impact criteria and scoring system, and provided feedback to the program organisers.

Earner contributed to the Green Impact program, outcomes of which are to create a more eco-friendly, inclusive, fair, and thriving organisation. The program creates an engaged community who is more aware of sustainability issues and motivated to act upon this awareness by realising multiple actions.
This badge is only available to students enrolled in an Australasian Higher Education Institution who have earned the ACTS Green Impact Auditor credential.
